briefdescription.para: Enum to be use as a Mode.

listitem.para: SELECT Enumeration indicating that the user is in a mode enabling him to select traces.

briefdescription.para: True if the the colors are in grey-scale.
Pointer to the status bar of the application.
Provider of the channels data.
True if the traces are displayed on multiple columns, false otherwise.
True if vertical lines are displayed to show the clusters, false otherwise.
True if a raster is drawn to show the clusters, false otherwise.
True if waveforms are drawn on top of the traces, false otherwise.
List of the presented channels.
True if the data information needed to draw the traces are available.
Array containing the traces data.
List containing the offset for each channel.
List of the factors use to calculate the ordinate value to been drawn.

detaileddescription.para: The factor equals 0.75 raised to the power of the gain (Yworld = alpha.factor.Ydata).

briefdescription.para: List of the exponents used to compute the drawing gain for each channel.

detaileddescription.para: The actual gain is 0.75 raised to the power of gain.

briefdescription.para: Size in pixels corresponding to the vertical space allocated to a trace.
Number of channels used to record the data.
Position of the peak among the points decribing waveforms.
Number of points used to describe a waveform.
This variable keeps track of the current start time of the time window.
This variable keeps track of the current end time of the time window.
Pointer on the ChannelColors storing the color information for the channels.
Map the correspondence between the channel group ids and the channel ids.

detaileddescription.para: Pointer to the variable belonging to NeuroscopeDoc.

briefdescription.para: Stores to which group each channel belongs.

detaileddescription.para: Pointer to the variable belonging to NeuroscopeDoc.

briefdescription.para: Map the correspondence between the channel group ids and the channel ids for the displayed channels.
Minimal abscissa in window coordinate.
Maximal abscissa in window coordinate.
Minimal ordinate in window coordinate.
Maximal ordinate in window coordinate.
The border on the left and right sides.
The border at the top and bottom.
The delta between the starting ordinates of two channels.
The delta between the starting abcisses of two channels.
Abscissa step between two points of a given trace.
Abscissa space between two groups (when groups are display on several columns).
Ordinate space between two channels.
Ordinate space between two groups (when groups are display on a single columns).
Ordinate space between the traces and the raster.
Ordinate space between two cluster trains.
The abscissa of the system coordinate center for the channel which is presented at the top of the view.
The ordinate of the system coordinate center for the channel which is presented at the top of the view.
The ordinate for the first cluster raster.
Buffer to enable smooth updating, obtain flicker-free drawing.
Time in milisseconds corresponding to a step between two points of a given trace.
Time in milisseconds corresponding to a step between two samples.
Acquisition system gain in recording unit by milivolts.
Unit gain in recording unit by centimeters.
Factor, in pixels by recording units, to convert the data in recording units to data in pixels of the world (Yworld = alpha.factor.Ydata).

detaileddescription.para: This factor is computed using the amplitude maximal of theta and the acquisition system gain.

briefdescription.para: List of the gains display next to each drawn channel.
Size in pixels corresponding to the height of a raster.
Time amount, in milisecond, of the time frame used to display the traces.
Stores the ordinate of the first sample of each channel.
Stores the abscissa of the first sample of each channel.
Border on the left and right sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
Border on the top and bottom sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
Boolean used to update the display after a change in the mode of display: single or multicolumns.
Boolean used to update the display after a resize event.
List of the selected channels.
Boolean used to update the display after a change in the number of groups.
Ordinate of the previous position while dragging an event.
Ordinate of the last click before dragging channels.
Boolean used to correctly display multicolumns at startup.
Screen resolution in pixel by centimeter, the default is 30 (equivalent to 75 pixels by inch).
Channel for which the voltage has to be determined.
Index of the starting drag, use to determine the time when selecting a zone for measure.
A cursor to represent the selection of channels.
A cursor to represent the measure state.
A cursor to represent the selection of time state.
A cursor to represent the selection of an event.
A cursor to represent the addition of an event.
A cursor to represent the drawing of a line.
Boolean indicating that the labels next to the traces have to be shown or hide.

detaileddescription.para: If true, they have to be shown, if false they have to be hidden. They are hidden by default.

briefdescription.para: Boolean indicating that the calibration scale has to be shown or hide.

detaileddescription.para: If true, the scale has to be shown, if false it has to be hidden. It is hidden by default.

briefdescription.para: Number of samples to leave out while drawing in order to speed the browsing of the data.

detaileddescription.para: This number takes into account the size of the window and the the size of the widget.

briefdescription.para: Boolean indicating that the view has been zoomed.
Initial downSampling before any zoom.
Stores the current factor of zoom.
Initial window before any zoom.
Window used before the current zoom.
The current size of a trace in the world while in multi columns mode.
The initial abscissa space between two groups (when groups are display on several columns) before any zoom.
The initial delta between the starting abcisses of two channels before any zoom.
The initial size of a trace in the world while in multi columns mode.
Map between the cluster provider names and the list of selected clusters.
Dictionary between the cluster provider names and the cluster data and status.
Dictionary between the cluster provider names and the providers.
Dictionary between the provider names and the item color lists except for the TracesProvider.
Stores the cluster order used when they are presented in raster.

detaileddescription.para: Each cluster is identified by a string build as the ClusterProvider name plus a dash plus the cluster id.

briefdescription.para: Stores the cluster raster ordinate position.
Stores the cluster raster abscissa position.
Map given the list of cluster file containing data for a given display group.

detaileddescription.para: This assumes that the cluster file names contain the identifier of the spike group used to create them (myFile.clu.1 correspond to the spike group 1).

briefdescription.para: Map between the event provider names and the list of selected events.
Pair storing the cluster provider having a selected cluster the closer in time to the current endTime, the pair stores also the starting time of the retrieve data.
Pair storing the cluster provider having a selected cluster the closer in time to the current startTime, the pair stores also the starting time of the retrieve data.
Stores the cluster provider which contains the cluster id look up in a nextCluster or previousCluster action.
This variable keeps track of the current start time of the time window in recording unit when browsing on the spikes.
This variable keeps track of the previous start time of the time window in recording unit when browsing on the spikes.
True if the user has just browsed spikes, false otherwise.
Dictionary between the event provider names and the event data and status.
Dictionary between the event provider names and the providers.
Pair storing the event provider having a selected event the closer in time to the current endTime, the pair stores also the starting time of the retrieve data.
Pair storing the event provider having a selected event the closer in time to the current startTime, the pair stores also the starting time of the retrieve data.
Stores the event provider which contains the event id look up in a nextEvent or previousEvent action.
Length of the recording in miliseconds.
Pair storing the event provider and the event id corresponding to the currently selected event.
Abscissa of the previous position while dragging channels.
Abscissa of the last click before dragging an event.
Contains the original abscissa and index of the selected event.
True if it is the beginning of an event dragging.
Stores the event providers containing events which have been modified and thus needing to be update.
Index of the new event to create.
Label corresponding to the type of event to create at the next addEvent.
Identifier of the event file to which a new event will be added.
Boolean indicating that the modification of an event is in process.
Map between the cluster provider names and the list of clusters to not be used for browsing.
Map between the event provider names and the list of events to not be used for browsing.
Default value for the border on the left and right sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
Default value for the border on the top and bottom sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).

memberdef.argsstring: (TracesProvider &tracesProvider, bool greyScale, bool multiColumns, bool verticalLines, bool raster, bool waveforms, bool labelsDisplay, QValueList< int > &channelsToDisplay, int unitGain, int acquisitionGain, long start, long timeFrameWidth, ChannelColors *channelColors, QMap< int, QValueList< int > > *groupsChannels, QMap< int, int > *channelsGroups, QValueList< int > &channelOffsets, QValueList< int > &gains, const QValueList< int > &skippedChannels, QWidget *parent=0, const char *name=0, QColor backgroundColor=Qt::black, KStatusBar *statusBar=0L, int minSize=500, int maxSize=4000, int windowTopLeft=-500, int windowBottomRight=1001, int border=0)
memberdef.name: TraceView

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

parameterdescription.para: a reference on the provider of the channels data.
true if all the channels are display either in a gradation of grey false if they are display in color.
true if the traces are displayed on multiple columns, false otherwise.
true if vertical lines are displayed to show the clusters, false otherwise.
true if a raster is drawn to show the clusters, false otherwise
true if waveforms are drawn on top of the traces, false otherwise.
true if labels are drawn next to the traces, false otherwise.
a reference on the list of channel to be shown at the opening of the view.
initial gain use to draw the traces.
acquisition gain.
starting time in miliseconds.
time window in miliseconds.
a pointer on the list of colors for the channels.
a pointer on the map given the list of channels for each group.
a pointer on the map given to which group each channel belongs.
a reference on the list containing the offset for each channel.
a reference on the list of the exponents used to compute the drawing gain for each channel.
list of skipped channels.
the parent QWidget.
name of the widget (can be used for introspection).
color used as background.
a reference to the application status bar.
minumum size of the view.
maximum size of the view.
the top-left corner of the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
bottom-right corner of the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
size of the border between the frame and the contents.

briefdescription.para: Sets the mode of presentation to single or multiple columns.

parameterdescription.para: true if the traces are presented on multiple columns, false if they are presented on a single column.

briefdescription.para: Displays or hides vertical lines to show the clusters.

parameterdescription.para: true if the vertical lines are drawn for each cluster, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Displays or hides a raster to show the clusters.

parameterdescription.para: true if a raster is drawn, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Displays or hides the cluster waveforms on top of the traces.

parameterdescription.para: true if the waveforms are drawn, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: All the channels of the display are now display either in a gradation of grey or in color.

parameterdescription.para: true if the channels have to be displayed in grey false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Updates the traces to show between start and start + timeFrameWidth.

parameterdescription.para: starting time in miliseconds.
time window in miliseconds.

briefdescription.para: Updates the list of channels shown with channelsToShow.

briefdescription.para: Increases of the amplitude of all the channels.
Decreases of the amplitude of all the channels.

briefdescription.para: Decreases of the amplitude of the selected channels.

briefdescription.para: Sets the unit gain and the acquisition system gain.

parameterdescription.para: initial gain use to draw the traces in the TraceView.
acquisition gain.

true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

Updates of the display due to a change in the display groups if active is true, otherwise simply updates the internal variables.

parameterdescription.para: true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: ids of the selected channels.

briefdescription.para: Resets the state of the view.
Shows or hide the labels next to the channels displaying the channel id and the gain.

parameterdescription.para: true if the labels have to be shown, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Shows or hide the calibration scale.

true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
